Fetch KEGG pathway data from KEGG

Source: R/fetch_kegg.R
fetch_kegg.Rd

Fetches gene IDs and corresponding pathway IDs and names for the provided organism.

fetch_kegg(species)

Arguments

species

a character value providing an abreviated species name. "hsa" for human, "eco" for E. coli and "sce" for S. cerevisiae. Additional possible names can be found for eukaryotes and for prokaryotes.

Value

A data frame that contains gene IDs with corresponding pathway IDs and names for a selected organism.

Examples

# \donttest{
kegg <- fetch_kegg(species = "hsa")

head(kegg)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   kegg_id   pathway_id    pathway_name                                   unipr…¹
#>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                                          <chr>  
#> 1 hsa:10327 path:hsa00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis - Homo sapiens (… P14550 
#> 2 hsa:10327 path:hsa00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis - Homo sapiens (… V9HWI0 
#> 3 hsa:124   path:hsa00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis - Homo sapiens (… P07327 
#> 4 hsa:125   path:hsa00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis - Homo sapiens (… P00325 
#> 5 hsa:125   path:hsa00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis - Homo sapiens (… V9HW50 
#> 6 hsa:126   path:hsa00010 Glycolysis / Gluconeogenesis - Homo sapiens (… P00326 
#> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​uniprot_id
# }
